intro: Viguiera deltoidea, commonly known as the delta bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Viguiera deltoidea is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
